00028 #ifndef _QMT_INTERNAL_H
00029 #define _QMT_INTERNAL_H
00030 
00031 #include "lquota_internal.h"
00032 
00033 /*
00034  * The Quota Master Target Device.
00035  * The qmt is responsible for:
00036  * - all interactions with MDT0 (provide request handlers, share ldlm namespace,
00037  *   manage ldlm lvbo, ...)
00038  * - all quota lock management (i.e. global quota locks as well as per-ID locks)
00039  * - manage the quota pool configuration
00040  *
00041  * That's the structure MDT0 connects to in mdt_quota_init().
00042  */
00043 struct qmt_device {
00044         /* Super-class. dt_device/lu_device for this master target */
00045         struct dt_device        qmt_dt_dev;
00046 
00047         /* service name of this qmt */
00048         char                    qmt_svname[MAX_OBD_NAME];
00049 
00050         /* Reference to the next device in the side stack
00051          * The child device is actually the OSD device where we store the quota
00052          * index files */
00053         struct obd_export       *qmt_child_exp;
00054         struct dt_device        *qmt_child;
00055 
00056         /* pointer to ldlm namespace to be used for quota locks */
00057         struct ldlm_namespace   *qmt_ns;
00058 
00059         /* Hash table containing a qmt_pool_info structure for each pool
00060          * this quota master is in charge of. We only have 2 pools in this
00061          * hash for the time being:
00062          * - one for quota management on the default metadata pool
00063          * - one for quota managment on the default data pool
00064          *
00065          * Once we support quota on non-default pools, then more pools will
00066          * be added to this hash table and pool master setup would have to be
00067          * handled via configuration logs */
00068         struct cfs_hash         *qmt_pool_hash;
00069 
00070         /* List of pools managed by this master target */
00071         struct list_head         qmt_pool_list;
00072 
00073         /* procfs root directory for this qmt */
00074         struct proc_dir_entry   *qmt_proc;
00075 
00076         /* dedicated thread in charge of space rebalancing */
00077         struct ptlrpc_thread     qmt_reba_thread;
00078 
00079         /* list of lqe entry which need space rebalancing */
00080         struct list_head         qmt_reba_list;
00081 
00082         /* lock protecting rebalancing list */
00083         spinlock_t               qmt_reba_lock;
00084 
00085         unsigned long            qmt_stopping:1; /* qmt is stopping */
00086 
00087 };
00088 
00089 /*
00090  * Per-pool quota information.
00091  * The qmt creates one such structure for each pool
00092  * with quota enforced. All the structures are kept in a hash which is used to
00093  * determine whether or not quota is enforced for a given pool.
00094  * We currently only support the default data pool and default metadata pool
00095  * with the pool_id 0.
00096  */
00097 struct qmt_pool_info {
00098         /* link to qmt's pool hash */
00099         struct hlist_node        qpi_hash;
00100 
00101         /* chained list of all pools managed by the same qmt */
00102         struct list_head         qpi_linkage;
00103 
00104         /* Pool key composed of pool_id | (pool_type << 16)
00105          * Only pool ID 0 is supported for now and the pool type is either
00106          * QUOTA_RES_MD or QUOTA_RES_DT.
00107          * immutable after creation. */
00108         __u32                    qpi_key;
00109 
00110         /* track users of this pool instance */
00111         atomic_t                 qpi_ref;
00112 
00113         /* back pointer to master target
00114          * immutable after creation. */
00115         struct qmt_device       *qpi_qmt;
00116 
00117         /* pointer to dt object associated with global indexes for both user
00118          * and group quota */
00119         struct dt_object        *qpi_glb_obj[MAXQUOTAS];
00120 
00121         /* A pool supports two different quota types: user and group quota.
00122          * Each quota type has its own global index and lquota_entry hash table.
00123          */
00124         struct lquota_site      *qpi_site[MAXQUOTAS];
00125 
00126         /* number of slaves registered for each quota types */
00127         int                      qpi_slv_nr[MAXQUOTAS];
00128 
00129         /* reference on lqe (ID 0) storing grace time. */
00130         struct lquota_entry     *qpi_grace_lqe[MAXQUOTAS];
00131 
00132         /* procfs root directory for this pool */
00133         struct proc_dir_entry   *qpi_proc;
00134 
00135         /* pool directory where all indexes related to this pool instance are
00136          * stored */
00137         struct dt_object        *qpi_root;
00138 
00139         /* Global quota parameters which apply to all quota type */
00140         /* the least value of qunit */
00141         unsigned long            qpi_least_qunit;
00142 
00143         /* Least value of qunit when soft limit is exceeded.
00144          *
00145          * When soft limit is exceeded, qunit will be shrinked to least_qunit
00146          * (1M for block limit), that results in significant write performance
00147          * drop since the client will turn to sync write from now on.
00148          *
00149          * To retain the write performance in an acceptable level, we choose
00150          * to sacrifice grace time accuracy a bit and use a larger least_qunit
00151          * when soft limit is exceeded. It's (qpi_least_qunit * 4) by default,
00152          * and user may enlarge it via procfs to get even better performance
00153          * (with the cost of losing more grace time accuracy).
00154          *
00155          * See qmt_calc_softlimit().
00156          */
00157         unsigned long            qpi_soft_least_qunit;
00158 };
00159 
00160 /*
00161  * Helper routines and prototypes
00162  */
00163 
00164 /* helper routine to find qmt_pool_info associated a lquota_entry */
00165 static inline struct qmt_pool_info *lqe2qpi(struct lquota_entry *lqe)
00166 {
00167         LASSERT(lqe_is_master(lqe));
00168         return (struct qmt_pool_info *)lqe->lqe_site->lqs_parent;
00169 }
00170 
00171 /* return true if someone holds either a read or write lock on the lqe */
00172 static inline bool lqe_is_locked(struct lquota_entry *lqe)
00173 {
00174         LASSERT(lqe_is_master(lqe));
00175         if (down_write_trylock(&lqe->lqe_sem) == 0)
00176                 return true;
00177         lqe_write_unlock(lqe);
00178         return false;
00179 }
00180 
00181 /* value to be restored if someone wrong happens during lqe writeback */
00182 struct qmt_lqe_restore {
00183         __u64   qlr_hardlimit;
00184         __u64   qlr_softlimit;
00185         __u64   qlr_gracetime;
00186         __u64   qlr_granted;
00187         __u64   qlr_qunit;
00188 };
00189 
00190 /* Common data shared by qmt handlers */
00191 struct qmt_thread_info {
00192         union lquota_rec        qti_rec;
00193         union lquota_id         qti_id;
00194         char                    qti_buf[MTI_NAME_MAXLEN];
00195         struct lu_fid           qti_fid;
00196         struct ldlm_res_id      qti_resid;
00197         union ldlm_gl_desc      qti_gl_desc;
00198         struct quota_body       qti_body;
00199         struct qmt_lqe_restore  qti_restore;
00200 };
00201 
00202 extern struct lu_context_key qmt_thread_key;
00203 
00204 /* helper function to extract qmt_thread_info from current environment */
00205 static inline
00206 struct qmt_thread_info *qmt_info(const struct lu_env *env)
00207 {
00208         struct qmt_thread_info  *info;
00209 
00210         info = lu_context_key_get(&env->le_ctx, &qmt_thread_key);
00211         if (info == NULL) {
00212                 lu_env_refill((struct lu_env *)env);
00213                 info = lu_context_key_get(&env->le_ctx, &qmt_thread_key);
00214         }
00215         LASSERT(info);
00216         return info;
00217 }
00218 
00219 /* helper routine to convert a lu_device into a qmt_device */
00220 static inline struct qmt_device *lu2qmt_dev(struct lu_device *ld)
00221 {
00222         return container_of0(lu2dt_dev(ld), struct qmt_device, qmt_dt_dev);
00223 }
00224 
00225 /* helper routine to convert a qmt_device into lu_device */
00226 static inline struct lu_device *qmt2lu_dev(struct qmt_device *qmt)
00227 {
00228         return &qmt->qmt_dt_dev.dd_lu_dev;
00229 }
00230 
00231 #define LQE_ROOT(lqe)    (lqe2qpi(lqe)->qpi_root)
00232 #define LQE_GLB_OBJ(lqe) (lqe2qpi(lqe)->qpi_glb_obj[lqe->lqe_site->lqs_qtype])
00233 
00234 /* helper function returning grace time to use for a given lquota entry */
00235 static inline __u64 qmt_lqe_grace(struct lquota_entry *lqe)
00236 {
00237         struct qmt_pool_info    *pool = lqe2qpi(lqe);
00238         struct lquota_entry     *grace_lqe;
00239 
00240         grace_lqe = pool->qpi_grace_lqe[lqe->lqe_site->lqs_qtype];
00241         LASSERT(grace_lqe != NULL);
00242 
00243         return grace_lqe->lqe_gracetime;
00244 }
00245 
00246 static inline void qmt_restore(struct lquota_entry *lqe,
00247                                struct qmt_lqe_restore *restore)
00248 {
00249         lqe->lqe_hardlimit = restore->qlr_hardlimit;
00250         lqe->lqe_softlimit = restore->qlr_softlimit;
00251         lqe->lqe_gracetime = restore->qlr_gracetime;
00252         lqe->lqe_granted   = restore->qlr_granted;
00253         lqe->lqe_qunit     = restore->qlr_qunit;
00254 }
00255 
00256 #define QMT_GRANT(lqe, slv, cnt)             \
00257         do {                                 \
00258                 (lqe)->lqe_granted += (cnt); \
00259                 (slv) += (cnt);              \
00260         } while (0)
00261 #define QMT_REL(lqe, slv, cnt)               \
00262         do {                                 \
00263                 (lqe)->lqe_granted -= (cnt); \
00264                 (slv) -= (cnt);              \
00265         } while (0)
00266 
00267 /* helper routine returning true when reached hardlimit */
00268 static inline bool qmt_hard_exhausted(struct lquota_entry *lqe)
00269 {
00270         if (lqe->lqe_hardlimit != 0 && lqe->lqe_granted >= lqe->lqe_hardlimit)
00271                 return true;
00272         return false;
00273 }
00274 
00275 /* helper routine returning true when reached softlimit */
00276 static inline bool qmt_soft_exhausted(struct lquota_entry *lqe, __u64 now)
00277 {
00278         if (lqe->lqe_softlimit != 0 && lqe->lqe_granted > lqe->lqe_softlimit &&
00279             lqe->lqe_gracetime != 0 && now >= lqe->lqe_gracetime)
00280                 return true;
00281         return false;
00282 }
00283 
00284 /* helper routine returning true when the id has run out of quota space:
00285  * - reached hardlimit
00286  * OR
00287  * - reached softlimit and grace time expired already */
00288 static inline bool qmt_space_exhausted(struct lquota_entry *lqe, __u64 now)
00289 {
00290         return (qmt_hard_exhausted(lqe) || qmt_soft_exhausted(lqe, now));
00291 }
00292 
00293 /* number of seconds to wait for slaves to release quota space after
00294  * rebalancing */
00295 #define QMT_REBA_TIMEOUT 2
